alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:43AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Bradford and central Alachua Counties through 430 AM EDT... At 342 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms from near Sampson to near University Of Florida. These storms will merge with storms moving in from the east across the Gainesville area. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, excessive cloud-to-ground lightning, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, University Of Florida, Orange Heights, Sampson, Gainesville Airport, Newnans Lake, Rochelle, Waldo, Hampton and Grove Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
